snippet: The deal, made with hundreds of American plaintiffs, comes after a jury in Brooklyn found the bank liable for dealings with the group Hamas; the court was to decide on damages starting Monday.
abstract: Arab Bank agrees to pay damages to around 500 American plaintiffs, including victims of terrorist attacks in Israel, who filed suit alleging that bank supported terrorism by carrying out transactions for members of militant Islamic group Hamas; amount of settlement, carried out under federal Anti-Terrorism Act, has yet to be determined; banking executives say case sets worrisome precedent.
lead_paragraph: The deal, made with hundreds of American plaintiffs, comes after a jury in Brooklyn found the bank liable for dealings with the group Hamas; the court was to decide on damages starting Monday.

headline.main: Arab Bank Reaches Settlement in Suit Accusing It of Financing Terrorism
headline.print_headline: Arab Bank, Already Found Liable, Settles on Damages in Terrorism Suit
